column2: amt, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had RA for 13yrs. I was on methotrexate,plaquenil and prednisone(when needed). Had to be taken off of plaquenil as it started messing up my vision. Been on enbrel for 5 wks. 1st shot gain 7 lbs of fluid overnight. The fluid went away the 2nd day. Still gain 3 lbs of fluid a week but goes away the 2nd or 3rd day after the shot. However, I have gained weight very fast in the 5 weeks I've been on it. I have missed more work since taking this. Have headaches daily, worse in the afternoon. I am more fatigue, shortness of breath, blood pressure shoots up then bottoms out. Seem to have more problems remembering things. I can't see any improvement at all. The sureclick is an easy way to give yourself the shot. So far I'm not impressed with this.

column2: bobbylam215, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
KansasSunflower, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug is extremely costly. The second issue is the headaches, dry nose and red, itchy spot on my injection area. This drug works, but I will tell you, the headache is crippling too. If it weren't for the severity of my RA, I would seek additional drug. Weight losss is more difficult on this drug.

column2: Melinda60, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for 4 weeks now.  I feel little relief.  Seems I have good days and bad days still.  My bad days are usually right before my short is due a day or two before.  I don't know what i think right now if its helping I have Lupus SLE.  And Fibro.

column2: kemorris, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA 2 years ago at age 68. I was started on Enbrel sure-click injections which I gave myself in my thigh weekly. I had no reaction to this injection, no pain, no swelling, no redness. It does help to let it warm for 45 min. before injecting, if it's cold it stings like a wasp sting.  During the treatment with this drug my Dr. also had me on low doses of Prednisone and on Methotrexate.  It took 5 months for the Enbrel shots to start taking effect but when they did I knew it immediately. It was like turning on a light switch. The downside was with the Methotrexate. This drug left me feeling absolutely breathless. I couldn't walk up or down stairs (or even to the mail box) without having to sit down and catch my breath.  I would find myself just sitting in the car driving to work and taking deep breaths so that I felt like I had enough air in my lungs.  I told the Dr. I did not want to take Methotrexate anymore because of the difficulty I had with breathing. Once that drug was stopped I felt really great taking low doses of Prednisone (5 mg daily) and the weekly Enbrel injections.  If Medicare paid for most of the cost of the Enbrel injections I would probably still be taking it.  I am now taking infusion drugs (first Remicade, and had to discontinue due to an allergic reaction) now trying Actemra (have only had 1 infusion so far) but honestly can't feel like it's doing much. I had to start taking 25 mg of Prednisone to get the swelling and inflammation under control that arose during the period I was off any drugs due to the allergic reaction to Remicade.  I am now on 20mg Prednisone daily and am virtually pain free. However...everyone knows this is an awful drug to take too, all things that help either in the short run or long run are taking a final toll on my longevity.  But I guess everyone has to decide for themselves what the trade offs are worth.

column2: SKR, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I HAVE HAD RA FOR OVER 2 YEARS, BUT JUST GOT DIAGNOSED THIS PAST NOVEMBER,2011. DUE TO MY BAD LIVER I CAN NOT TAKE ANIINFAMITORIES, SO I HAVE BEEN ON METHOTREXATE, AND I STATED ENBREL 2 WEEKS AGO. AS OF NOW I AM JUST GETTING THE HEADACHES, AND THE REDNESS AROUND THE SITE, BUT IT VERY HARD FOR ME B/C I AM ALSO A TYPE 1 DIABETIC., I HOPE THIS MEDICATION WORKS. IT SUX BEING 24 AND YOU CANT EVER DO ANYTHING. I WRK 8 HRS A DAY, BUT WHEN I GET HOME I SLEEP .

column2: Rein75, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Enbrel is great, it has helped a great deal! A big change in my mobility. It was very hard for me to get out of bed, get up from sitting down on chairs, sofas, etc. But I'm losing alot of my hair! Has anyone else had this happen to them. I don't want to lose my hair so I'm really considering stopping this medication! So good luck to all! Hope this doesn't happen to you!

column2: micheal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: It brought my symptoms under control.  I no longer have flares.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Enbrel for 1 year, diagnosed with inflammatory arthritis. I was on MTX 30mg/wk and had tried Plaquinil and had many cortizone injections. After my first injection within 3 days I could not believe how well I felt. Before I could barely get out of bed.  I now take the injection (sureclick) twice a month, no MTX or cortizone.  I feel really good and have had no flares. I do sometimes have a raised red mark at the site of injection. I need to try the ice before injecting. Hope I continue to feel good.

column2: barbella, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: my skin was so bad that i would not go swimming,or do anything that would show my psoriasis.my knees,elbows and chest looked like i had a severe case of poison oak.i tried all kinds of ointments and creams.i was depressed and had a big complex.then i was introduced www.enbrel.at first i kept delaying the date i was to start it.i'm not afraid of needles,but i was afraid of me,injecting myself.i would tell my dr.,i've got a cold,just because of the chance's of infection. it wasn't until a friend of mine,a diabetic,explained to me in a way that it put me to ease,so i felt comfortable enough to do it. well 10 to 14 days later you cannot even tell i have it. i've been using enbrel 3 years now and i do not feel any side effects at all.i inject myself twice a week,with the 25mg.i even get financial assistance as well

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Enbrel for 5 years and it has truly been a miracle for me and put my RA in remission.  The medication is highly acidic and burns terribly when injected but only for a few seconds.  The burning is well worth it for me!

column2: sandyhembree, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I agree the shot hurt like burning hell going into your leg but wouldnt even be able to get out of bed if I wasnt on Enbrel. I spent 2 years of my life in bed suffering and it took another 2 years for the doctor to finally Rx Enbrel and a month later I was a differant person.

column2: Santrap, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using Enbrel for about 7 months. I have had moderate Psoriasis since I was 8 and progressed to severe in my teens(I am 50 now)In my lifetime I have used ever topical that ever came out. Most did little to nothing and some did really well at first then became less effective after little use. I have been in many studies and have been poked, prodded, cut on and paraded. I am sure that if you look at the current college dermatologist text books you will see a picture of me. After reading the side effect of Enbrel I was scared to use it. My last visit to my Dr. before starting Enbrel, I was more that 90% covered and the sides of my chest would split and bleed each time I raised my arms. I began using the sureclick injections twice a week. In the third week the splits in my side cleared up and the Plaques began to shrink. Around 7 to 10 weeks the Plaques had disappeared and red spots were less noticeable. Around 12 to 14 weeks the red spots disappeared. I still have a few spots and scares that the psoriasis left but it is nothing like I have ever experienced. I feel like a normal person for the first time in my adult life. I have not had any problems from using Enbrel yet and I would like to stand up and be counted and as a Enbrel success story. Enbrel has given me a much happier life and I am truly thankful. My hope is that other people that can get the same results that i have had.

column2: vcowan329, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking for 3 1/2 months it does nothing for me.  I had first thought that it was working but the longer I have taken it have found that it is iseless for me.

column2: vcowan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using Enbrel Sure Click SQ for about 2 months now IU also take Methotrexate Inj. I was doing both shots on different days and would only get about 2 days from each shot.  Dr had me doing both shots the same day and has been a little better.  Will see if it gets better if not they will change me to something else.  Also had to go back on prenisone everyday.

column2: Joe Mike, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: could hardly walk or move, within about 6months, I ride a bike, walk all the time andmy psoriasis has clear almost completely. I don't know what I would do without it!

column2: smokey, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Enbrel for nearly 8 years for my RA. I use the Sure Clic pen and it's very easy to use. The joint pain in my hands is under control and I live a very active life. Work out at gym & golf 4 times /week. Couldn"t imagine life without Enbrel.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had rheumatoid arthritis for approx 11 years, this is the best I have ever felt. I move easily in the mornings without difficulty and exercise regularly.  The sureclick is difficult to self inject at first because of the joint inflammation, but once controlled it gets easier.

column2: chente520, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Before taking enbrel I was barely able to get out of bed. I suffered with daily flare ups and was always fatigued. Since taking enbrel most of my symptoms are under control and the deformation of my joints I have noticed has slowed down tremendously!!

column9: Been on the medicine for 8 weeks now. It helped in the begining with joint pain. But now my wrist are poping and hurting so is my ankle. It decreased the scales due to psorisis but has not cleared it up all the way.

column2: scates, 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I gained until the day I quit using it. Would I do it again? No but It does force me to look elsewhere other than western medicine. Best of Luck to you.

column9: Used Enbrel after 1 year of other medications (Planquinil/ sulfsulzine/ Methtraxate). My condition was improoved a lot after the first week of Enbrel. However, it didn't get rid of my imflamation on one foot. My experience is enbrel + Methtraxate is powerful. I am trying to have a baby, so I just take Enbrel along now and it controls the symptom pretty well that I can live my normal life without feeling too much pain. I found excercise also improve the joint stiffness and pain a lot. I even thought I cured my RA with excercise daily. However, I had a flare up which make me realized that I still need my medication to control the disease. All in all, big thumb up for the enbrel.

column2: Susan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for 10 years in which I have been controlled with methotrexate, plaquenil, and sulfasalzine.  I have used prednisone when having a flare. I started Enbrel in Oct. and I have two shots remaining to complete 6 months of treatment.  I am only able to work every other day and it seems I have many more bad days than good days. I am very disappointed this drug did not work for me.  I talked to the doctor about switching to something else.  He mentioned Simponi but not sure what we will do next. If any one out there has gone from Enbrel to another drug that did work for them I would appreciate the name of it.

column9: I credit Enbrel for giving me my ease of life back. I am 24 and got diagnosed with RA when I was 4. I started taking Enbrel when it first came out about six years ago. My only problem with Enbrel is that I spend the whole day dizzy and light-headed after the injection and I also have injection site reactions that seem to go away if I put a cold pack on the area for about 10 minutes.

column9: I have been on Enbrel for 3 months and can feel the difference by 75%, and getting better. But the price scares me to death. I am low income and get the Embrel quick assist for one year but then whatdo you do. I hate to get use to something then have to lose it. Its a very very costly drug.

column2: Allie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed RA for 1.5 yrs, pain for 5.5.  Enbrel didn't work for me, but after writing a scathing review on the Humira pen, decided I should write here about how great the Enbrel pen is.  The inventor of the 2nd (finished!) click is a genius (Humira doesn't have it).  I would have rated the pen a 5/5 but since it didn't relieve pain, that's not really fair!  ;-)I felt much more confident injecting $400 (or $800 with Humira) of drug into my body with the Enbrel pen.Be sure to take the Enbrel out to sit 30 min. before injecting, and ice your leg for 5+ min before you inject.  Spread the skin out flat (with Humira you have to grab it and plump it up - another peeve of mine!). And ice afterwards, too.  If this drug works for you the pain would be so worth it!There is an assistance program to help people with the cost of biologics.  Talk to your local Arthritis Foundation chapter for help.  I'm lucky that I haven't paid a penny for Enbrel or Humira - my copay is covered in full for the first 6 months of either drug by the respective drug companies (up to $275/mo, I think it is).  Be sure to ask your rheumie for the discount card (looks like a credit card) you give to your pharmacist - available to all just for asking.Good luck, and may everyone reading this have a pain free (and psoriasis free!) day!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
an103170, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: patti, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed about five years ago. I am on my husband's insurance which his employer seems to change every six months and not one of them would approve this type of drug for me.  We finally got a managed health plan who approved this drug and though I was afraid to take it at first, I soon found out what a wonderful drug it is.  I am able to get out of bed every morning, the stiffness has gone from a couple of hours to about 15 minutes or so and I feel so much better!  I still have a flare up every once in awhile (not as often as before Enbrel) and take Prednisone for that.  I am so thankful that my rheumatologist put me on Enbrel, it has literally been a life-saver.

column2: frustrated patient, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed 39 yrs.ago with psoriatic arthritis and lived on naprosyn for approx. 13 yrs. refusing prednisone and methodtrexate due to side effects.  I have had many operations on my feet due to severe damage to joints & also hands.  I started Enbrel in 2002 and was amazed how it stopped future damage and gave me back movement and cleared psoraisis somewhat. In late 06 early 07 had an infection and continued taking Enbrel.  After 4 different antibiotics, very low blood pressure and weakness and development of a rash reaction to the antibiotics realized I should have stopped Enbrel during this time. Ever since I have a pustile type rash over my legs, feet and hands,now starting on my back. Dr.& Dermatologist said it was due to Enbrel, switched me to Humira.  After 2 injec.severe swelling in ankles, one side effect of Humira is onset of Congestive Heart failure.  Dr.refused to refill Enbrel prescrip.and wants me to take Methotrexate in addition to Enbrel.  Has anyone using Enbrel experienced this same pustile rash and if so what worked to you?

column2: lbrylski, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started enbrel about three weeks ago. I am using it to rid myself of my embarassing psoriasis. I also have psoriatic arthoritis. I have been on approx. 10 different topocal creams. None of them gave me any relief. Enbrel already after a few shots has helped me immensley. I cant wait to see the full results. THANK YOU ENBREL!! I did feel sick at first. kind of like morning sickness. the injection doesn't hurt but the medicine going in does burn quite a bit.

column2: Bernsells, 45-54 Female
column9: sometimes i am unable to push the pen to inject myself==hard to press

column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: ASstinks, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have AS and this drug has been extremely helpful for me. I could barely walk up-right until I started taking Enbrel, I saw significant improvement in my overall health within weeks. The injection site is always swollen, red and itchy but the small discomfort is well worth it!

column2: CmdrRabb282, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started using Enbrel 3 months ago. I had to use a cane to get around, but no longer have to. Just days after using Enbrel I felt a thousand times better. The ease of using the Sureclick is so easy. Doctors had me on Hydrocodone, Methotrexate, Celebrex, to name a few, and none really relieved the pain like Enbrel does. Thanks a million to those R & D people who worked on this drug.

column2: eeyoressqueez, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only used it for 5 weeks now but it is working, I was on so many other drugs that worked for a while, then would get my liver. I started with the injections and it was terrable I would get the itching,redness,swelling. Now I get the sure click and thank GOD it is fantastic, no reactions at the sight, not painfull to inject like the needle was. My husband jumped so high because he was releaved that the sure click was so easy.  I have many other diseases, uveitis,ostepoina,ra,and now I have been able to even lower my use of steroids graduly and am lower than I have ever been able to get on steroids in 6 yrs so I would say this is a FANTASTIC DRUG. If your insurance dosn't pay for it then call 1-888-4PPA, they can help get it paid for or help pay for some of it. Good luck and thank you for this fantastic medication!!!!!

column2: Mark, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for 25 years.  I could barely move my fingers, hands, arms and walking was painful.  I had many nodules in my fingers, arms and feet.  I take Enbrel along with 17.5 mg Methotrexate.  I am able to work full time.  Many nodules have disappeared.  Still have some stiffness, but no swelling and pain has been reduced by 80%.  Noticed improvement after a few weeks.  Have been on Enbrel for just over a year now.  I highly recommend this medicine.

column2: riley-dorothy3224@sbcglobal.net, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Has this drug been successful in treating Alzheimers patients?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had JRA since age 7 and have tried several medications in the past.  I started using the injections before the sureclick came out and was very pleased with how well Enbrel worked for me.  After I switched to the pen I started to have horrible injection site reactions.  The site would swell, itch and become hot for a week.  If I gave the shot in my stomach you could see the swelling through my shirt.  My doctor then switched me back to the syringes but it kept happening so I had to switch medicines.  I was very upset b/c nothing has worked quite the same since then.

column2: Organized Kitty,  Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA about 2 years ago.  Although other medications helped, my doctor highly recommended Enbrel and he was right!  I've been on it now for 8 months and feel better than I ever have.  The sureclick is so easy to use and the company has a great support system. I felt signficant reductions of my RA symptoms in just a few short weeks.  I had to fight my insurance company to pay for this but I tell people that I'm so glad I did because I have a new lease on life and can now keep up with my 5 year old daughter!

column2: chskid, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was 13 when i first started using enbrel. I have AS, and i saw IMMEDIATE improvement, in about 2-3 days. Had been on methotrexate for a few months, but didnt help even 1/100 as much as enbrel.

column2: pyramid, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started on this drug in Feb 2007.  There has been a remarkable cessation of pain and swelling in my joints.  I consider it amazing.

column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: V, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with A.S. 2 years ago and tried Sulfazalizine to control the pain and it gave me bad headaches and itchy eyes. My doctor switched me to Enbrel and the pain is almost non-existent. I would recommened anyone with A.S. to try this medication if their insurance covers the costs.

column2: rHendrix, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was using enbrel for about 4 weeks and my psoriasis was begining to show improvement and my joints were getting better, then I had a really bad allergic reaction and had to discontinue the medication

After months of misdiagnosis, scars over 80% of my body, and the unbearable scratching, I decided that something had to be done. All the topical creams were too expensive and there were no results. Enbrel has helped me live a normal life and not be ashamed of the scars of the past.

column2: tequilasunriser, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've only been on Enbrel for 2 months, but I feel like there has been some improvement along with the methotrexate. I was a bit leary about doing the sureclick the first time, but like someone else stated, it's a piece of cake! I would've never been able to do the syringe thing because  of the immobility in my hands and fingers. Thanks Enbrel!

column2: Dallasemmitt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Enbrel since before it was first approved on the market.  My doctor  had tried everything else.  Enbrel has come a long way and it is getting better and better.  People who start using Enbrel and begin with the Sureclick, have no idea what others and the company have gone through to improve the drug and the way it is to be given.  This company is the most supportive company I have ever dealt with when it comes to prescriptions.  They are there 24/7 and believe me, I have used their services literally HUNDREDS of times since the drug first came out.  It does not solve all of my Psoriatic Arthritis problems, but it is doing more than any other drug has.  They (the company) help in more ways than I wish to get into here, but lets just say that I will owe them forever for all that they have done for me.

column2: joodles85, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is a very easy drug to use, I could NEVER do a traditional injection. The thought makes me ight headed. The sure click is very simple. After the first time( pulling the trigger for me) it was a piece of cake.

column1: Joint Inflammatory Disease in Children and Young Adults
column2: Sally, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 57 year old female and have been very physically active instructing dance and fitness for 30 years.  Two years ago my right hand began and forearm began bothering me terribly.  I had PT for bracitis (sp?) for several months and that helped considerably.  A bit later, I had a lot of swelling and pain in the same area (hand esp).  After seeing a rheumatologist, and several tests, I began Enbrel shots along with a sulfa based drug.  I get sick to my stomach if I take too many of the Sulfa drugs.  I have had great results with Enbrel!  It has helped me so much, I couldn't believe it.  I could see and feel so much improvement after one shot.  I am able to exercise again and feel so much better.  However, not sure if it is the lack of exercise in the last year, but I have gained about 10 pounds.  Of course I don;t like that part of it, but am working on it.  I am wondering however, if Enbrel has a side effect that causes weight gain.  Any help from anyone on this idea is welcome.  Sally

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: BEEN ON THIS FOR A YEAR NOW AND IT HAS MADE A WORLD OF DIFFERENCE
